item.title: Combat Bows
item.description: Combat Bows (or just “Bows”) first appeared back when the Forsaken yearly expansion dropped in September, 2018. Bungie dropped a Developer Insights video discussing how they were built; it’s actually really good - check it out! There are two bow frames: Lightweight and Precision, with behaviour similar to other weapons with frames of the same names. The lighterweight, faster-firing frames have lower damage and are easier to control, often with improved Handling and/or Stability.

item.title: Fusion Rifles
item.description: This is primarily a transcription of Castle’s amazing video that you should watch post haste. “Nobody Understands THIS about Fusion Rifles…" - Castle Content Since D1, I’ve greatly enjoyed Fusion Rifles as they’re one of the most unique weapons Destiny has to offer. They’re also pretty darn confusing to reason about. Now that fusions have been completely reworked and rebalanced during Season 15, it’s time to forget most of what I knew and dive back in.

item.title: Hand Cannons
item.description: 2021/08/29: Needs updating as the sandbox has changed with respect to Range on Hand Cannons Effects of Range PART 1 : Range MEANS NOTHING on Hand Cannons - CoolGuy, 2019-10-28 Adding Range to a Hand Cannon has minimal gain. “You shouldn’t dismantle a great Hand Cannon roll because it isn’t max range.” When you add on Range to a Hand Cannon you get minimal gains: (35 Range = 25m falloff, 86 Range = 28m)

item.title: Shotguns
item.description: Season 15 Shotgun-related changes 7/6 3.2.1 - Too complex to summarize. Search for “Weapon Archetypes”. 8/21 TWAB - While sliding, players now incur the following weapon penalties: -20 Stability, +15% shotgun pellet spread, 1.5x flinch Rifled Barrel v. Full Choke Rifled Barrel vs Full Choke, Which is Better? - Fallout Plays, 2019-09-19 Tested both barrels on all four shotgun archetypes because there was a common misconception that barrels perform differently on different archetypes (they do not).

item.title: Swords
item.description: Fallout Plays put together a terrific in-depth analysis of everything Swords. If you know of any other content, please let me know! Sword Frames Lightweight: Usable only by Hunters. There are two of these swords. Adaptive: Usable by all classes. While Warlocks do not have a specific type dedicate to them, they do have unique access to the Infinite Guard perk. Aggressive: Usable only by Titans. There are two of these as well.
